thread.title: Homecoming Crash Is Latest in String of Tragedies For OSU
thread.title_full: Homecoming Crash Is Latest in String of Tragedies For OSU

title: Homecoming Crash Is Latest in String of Tragedies For OSU
text:
Get Sports Alerts 
26 Oct 2015 01:44 PM EST 
Tragedies keep striking Oklahoma State University. Four years ago OSU had to cope with losing two basketball coaches in a plane crash. 14 years ago a plane crash killed two basketball players and several staff members. Now the campus is facing perhaps its most difficult test â€” coping with four dying after a driver plowed into the university's homecoming parade. A former professor and his wife, a 2-year-old boy and a student from a nearby college were killed when a 25-year-old woman drove her car into a crowd assembled for the homecoming parade, officials said. The alleged driver, Adacia Chambers, has been charged with murder in the crash, in which another 47 people were hurt. Police are still investigating the cause of the crash. Some say it was drunk driving while the family of the alleged driver claim she has a mental illness and blacked out at the wheel.
